TEST.0.title: 2023 North Carolina State Division B
TEST.0.customHeader:
Names of participants: (Please print neatly)

 
 
 
School Name:

Warning: Do not open this packet until given permission to do so.    Note: There are useful notes after this page.

CIPHER.12.cipherString: Discovery consists of looking at the same thing as everyone else and thinking something different.
CIPHER.12.question: A quote from Albert Szent-Gyorgyi has been encoded as an Aristocrat, what does it say?

CIPHER.34.cipherString: Well done is better than well said.
CIPHER.34.question: The following quote from Benjamin Franklin needs to be decoded with the Affine Cipher where a=15 and b=11.

CIPHER.13.cipherString: Let us be of good cheer, remembering that the misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never happen.
CIPHER.13.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by James Russel Lowell which has the word CHEER in it.

CIPHER.37.cipherString: It's more fun when you're not the only one having it.
CIPHER.37.question: A quote from the Oaqui has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has ONL in it corresponding to the encoded text 765458.

CIPHER.40.cipherString: You were born to stand out, stop trying to fit in.
CIPHER.40.question: A quote from Roy T. Bennett has been encoded using the Pollux Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 0=–, 4=●, 5=×, 6=×

CIPHER.36.cipherString: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
CIPHER.36.question: Decrypt this quote by Franklin Delano Roosevelt which has been encrypted with a Rail Fence Cipher using between 4 and 6 rails.

CIPHER.41.cipherString: The perfect is the enemy of the good.
CIPHER.41.question: The following quote from Voltaire has been encoded using the Affine Cipher. You are told that O decodes to be R and Z decodes to be S.

CIPHER.24.cipherString: Making comparisons can spoil your happiness.
CIPHER.24.question: A quote from Maria von Heland has been encoded using the Pollux Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 0=×, 1=–, 2=●, 6=–, 7=×, 3=●.

CIPHER.30.cipherString: Put off thy cares with thy clothes; so shall thy rest strengthen thy labor; and so shall thy labor sweeten thy rest.
CIPHER.30.question: Decode this quote by Francis Quarles which has been encoded with a a Caesar Cipher.  You are told that R decodes to G.

CIPHER.33.cipherString: An attentive reader will always learn more, and more quickly, from good authors than from life.
CIPHER.33.question: Encode this quote by Hervé Le Tellier with an Atbash Cipher.

CIPHER.28.question: After solving the cryptarithm COAST+SHORE=SUNTAN decode the phrase 29765 374251 2084697 965271.

CIPHER.20.cipherString: All that we are is the result of what we have thought.
CIPHER.20.question: The following symbols encode a phrase by Buddha using a Baconian alphabet. You are told that is starts out with ALL, what does it say?

CIPHER.15.cipherString: When the grass looks greener on the other side of the fence, it may be that they take better care of it there.
CIPHER.15.question: A quote from Cecil Selig has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. You are told that it is encrypted with a K1 alphabet and it starts with WHEN.

CIPHER.35.cipherString: Patience is the support of weakness; impatience is the ruin of strength.
CIPHER.35.question: A quote from Charles Caleb Colton has been encoded using the Rail Fence Cipher for you to decode. You are told that between 4 and 6 rails were used to encode it.

CIPHER.17.cipherString: You only have two due a very phew things write in your life sew long as ewe don't dew to many things wrong.
CIPHER.17.question: Your friend told you some advice from Warren Buffett in the form of a Cryptogram, but your friend is a terrible speller. You are told it contains the word WRITE.

CIPHER.38.cipherString: It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy that makes happiness.
CIPHER.38.question: The following quote from Charles Sprugeon has been encoded with the Porta Cipher using a very common word for the key. The 38th through 41st cipher characters (MUUK) decode to be THAT

CIPHER.19.cipherString: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
CIPHER.19.question: The following letters encode a phrase by Oscar Wilde using a Baconian alphabet. What does it say?

CIPHER.29.cipherString: Take a deep breath, count to ten, and tackle each task one step at a time.
CIPHER.29.question: The following quote from Linda Shalaway has been encoded with the Porta Cipher using a very common word for the key. The 6th through 9th cipher characters (RNRB) decode to be DEEP

CIPHER.26.cipherString: Great leaders create more leaders, not followers.
CIPHER.26.question: A quote from Roy T. Bennett has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 6=××, 3=×–, 4=––, 5=●●, 9=●–, 1=●×.

CIPHER.32.cipherString: One who knows what he or she knows as well as what he or she does not know is a genius.
CIPHER.32.question: Decode this quote from Abhijit Naskar which has been encoded with the Atbash Cipher.

CIPHER.18.cipherString: The most important key to achieving great success is to decide upon your goal and launch, get started, take action, move.
CIPHER.18.question: A famous quote from John Wooden has been encoded as a Patristocrat using a K1 alphabet. You are told that letters TMGPZ map to KEACT.

CIPHER.31.cipherString: You got to insist on your success, resist every obstacle and persist in times of difficulty and you will get there.
CIPHER.31.question: Encode this quote from Israelmore Ayivor with a Caesar Cipher and a shift of 9 (e.g. P encodes to Y).

CIPHER.25.cipherString: Find a purpose to serve, not a lifestyle to live.
CIPHER.25.question: A quote from Criss Jami has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 2=–●, 9=––, 7=–×, 1=××, 8=×–

CIPHER.14.cipherString: Sometimes you can see things happen right in front of your eyes and still jump to the wrong conclusions.
CIPHER.14.question: Solve this Aristocrat which is a quote by Jodi Picoult which starts with the letters SOME.

CIPHER.27.cipherString: Just a grain can bring a bird down from the skies.
CIPHER.27.question: A quote from Vineet Raj Kapoor has been encoded using the Fractionated Morse Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote ends with KIES.

CIPHER.16.cipherString: If being happy is important to you, try this: instead of regretting all you lack, celebrate all you've got.
CIPHER.16.question: A quote from Brian Vaszily has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher and a K2 alphabet for you to decode. You are told that the quote contains one occurence the word TRY.

CIPHER.23.cipherString: Life is either daring adventure or nothing.
CIPHER.23.question: A quote from Helen Keller has been encoded using the Pollux Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 6=●, 1=–, 3=×, 0=×, 4=●

CIPHER.22.cipherString: Puede que nunca sepas los resultados de tus acciones, pero si no haces nada, no habrá resultados.
CIPHER.22.question: Solve this Xenocrypt which is a translation of a quote by Gandhi into Spanish and has been encoded with a K1 alphabet using an English keyword. You are told that the quote contains the word SEPAS.
CIPHER.22.translation: You may never know what results come of your actions, but if you do nothing, there will be no results.

CIPHER.39.cipherString: The superior man wishes to be slow in his words and earnest in his conduct.
CIPHER.39.question: Decode a quote from CONFUCIUS that has been encoded using the Rail Fence Cipher. You are told that it starts with THES and between 2 and 5 rails were used to encode it.

CIPHER.21.cipherString: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
CIPHER.21.question: The following strange phrases encode a quote from Friedrich Nietzsche using a Baconian Cipher. You are told that the deciphered text contains for can somewhere
